title: As an EBIS User, I want to be notified if I upload a problematic PDF
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a user attaches a PDF, ebis has the ability to know if it will cause problems downstream
* If a user uploads a PDF that is determined to be problematic, the system will return an error message:
** Title: Error
** Body: The attached file has been determined to be non-compliant.  Please attach a different file.  If you continue to receive this message, please contact [ebissupport@mlb.com|mailto:ebissupport@mlb.com] and provide the non-compliant file.
** Buttons: Ignore & Continue (BOC Only), Back

AC: 

* Under Minor Contracts, there will be a MN Payroll widget with a Player Summary table
* On the bottom right corner of the Player Summary table, there will be an â€œUpdate Datesâ€� button
* The â€œUpdate Datesâ€� button will be grayed out if no player is currently selected
* Once the players are selected, and the user clicks on the Update Dates button, a modal will appear that will allow one to edit the dates that the player reported to training for a selected period
* The modal will have â€œ# players selectedâ€� displayed under the â€œUpdate Datesâ€� header
* There will be a dropdown menu under the player name to select the training period
* There will be a table to add date ranges that the player reported to training
** Action buttons:
*** â€œAdd date rangeâ€�
**** Clicking this button will add a new row for date range
*** Trashcan button
**** Clicking this will delete date range row
*** â€œUpdateâ€�
**** Clicking this will commit changes, dismiss modal, and display a blue success notification
*** â€œCancelâ€�
**** Clicking this will dismiss the modal without making any updated
* There will be a warning text above the â€œUpdateâ€� and â€œCancelâ€� buttons that says:
** â€œThis will overwrite any existing dates the player has for the period
* Users will only be allowed to specify dates within the selected training period
* Once the appropriate dates are updated, and the user selects â€œUpdate,â€� a â€œDates updatedâ€� message will appear

AC:

* To the left of the the â€œPlayerâ€� column in the Player Summary table on the MN Payroll dashboard, there will be a column with maximize/minimize buttons for each row
* The buttons will default to show the minimized view
* When selected, the row of the selected button will expand to show a more detailed view of the days that the player reported to trainingÂ

title: As a League Economics user I want to use the rebate information from the CBT Payors Utility on the CBT assessment report
custom_steps:
Starting with 2023 there will be a new â€˜rebateâ€™ column on the CBT Assessment report for any clubs who have an entry in the True up overages section of the CBT Payors utility.  The value will be the sum of all overages

[https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1634|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1634|smart-link]

title: As a League Economics user I want a CBT Payors Utility for tracking CBT pay rebates and payor orgs
custom_steps:
There will be a new CBT Payors utility accessed via the Major Contracts left nav menu.

The utility will have a year selection dropdown the first year to be displayed will be 2023.  To start, that will be the only option.  After the end of the mj season, 2024 should begin to display.  The default value will always be the current year.

Beneath the year selection there will be a â€˜True Up Overagesâ€™ section.  Users will be able to add a player, an org, and an overage amount to this section

Beneath the overages section, there will be a CBT Payors section.  Users will be able to add an org, a charged tax rate, and paid_amt (info is stored in mjc_payroll_tax_payors table) to this section. 



The new utility should have its own permissions:

EBIS-CBT-PAYORS-EDITORS

EBIS-CBT-PAYORS-VIEWERS

These permissions should be added respectively to:

ebis-mjc-boc-admin-role
ebis-mjc-boc-viewer-role
custom_expected:
The utility will have a year selection dropdown the first year to be displayed will be 2023.  To start, that will be the only option.  After the end of the mj season, 2024 should begin to display.  The default value will always be the current year.

Beneath the year selection there will be a â€˜True Up Overagesâ€™ section.  Users will be able to add a player, an org, and an overage amount to this section

Beneath the overages section, there will be a CBT Payors section.  Users will be able to add an org, a charged tax rate, and paid_amt (info is stored in mjc_payroll_tax_payors table) to this section. 



The new utility should have its own permissions:

EBIS-CBT-PAYORS-EDITORS

EBIS-CBT-PAYORS-VIEWERS

These permissions should be added respectively to:

ebis-mjc-boc-admin-role
ebis-mjc-boc-viewer-role

[https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3786509/List+of+MJ+Roster+Statuses|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3786509/List+of+MJ+Roster+Statuses|smart-link]

AC:

* When a MJ/MN Outright Transaction is submitted, the player will have a pending roster status of "Outrighted"
* When a MJ/MN Outright Transaction is approved, the player will have a roster status of "Outrighted"
* This roster status will appear on profiles and widgets
* The roster status will be searchable
* The roster status will appear on reports
* This roster status will function similar to â€œOptionedâ€� and will be displayed along with the MN Roster Status

title: Break glass login to bypass Okta
custom_steps:
*As a* BOC Draft Admin

*I want* to be able to login to EBIS without using Okta

*So that* I can still run the draft in EBIS in case of an Okta outage



*Acceptance Criteria*

* Navigating to [https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/admin-login|https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/admin-login] displays a login form with Username/Password inputs
* A database table exists in ebis that allows developers to enter temporary allowed â€œbreak glassâ€� username/password combos
* Attempting to login to admin-login sends the credentials using Basic authentication and validates the username/password combo against the db
** On invalid creds, show an error message
** On valid creds, authorize as the specified user and forward to the ebis home page
* Subsequent requests after login use Basic authentication and validate credentials against the database on every request
** Invalid credentials result in a 401 response, which should redirect the user back to the normal [https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/login|https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/login] page
* On successful okta login through [https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/login|https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/login], admin login credentials are cleared and Okta access token is used again



*Technical notes*

* passwords should be stored encrypted
* angular (and eventually, react) apps should use localStorage['ebis-auth-store'] to store basic auth credentials. ebis-auth-store json object should only ever have either the basicAuthCredentials or the accessToken/idToken/refreshToken so that itâ€™s unambiguous which the http interceptor should use, however, if both are somehow present, favor the accessToken.

title: Set up new React project and routing to allow seamless front end for EBIS React
custom_steps: For this task, Iâ€™m going to create and deploy 2 fake react pages accessible via direct link in the ebis app to get all of the infrastructure and routing set up. They will be at {{https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisapp/poc/tab1}} and {{https://ebis.mlb.com/ebisapp/poc/tab2}} and will have very simple UIs.
